title: Periods of two planets orbiting different stars

content.question: Planet 1 orbits Star 1 and Planet 2 orbits Star 2 in circular orbits of the same radius. However, the orbital period of Planet 1 is longer than the orbital period of Planet 2. What could explain this?

choices.label: Star 1 has less mass than Star 2.
Star 1 has more mass than Star 2.
Planet 1 has less mass than Planet 2.
Planet 1 has more mass than Planet 2.
The masses of the planets are much less than the masses of the stars.

content.answer: Star 1 has less mass than Star 2.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
